alternative_title: Employers' tax and reporting if you pay the cost of school fees for an employee's child
overview: Tax and reporting rules for employers covering the cost of school fees for the child of an employee
title: Expenses and benefits: school fees for an employee's child

table.body:
As an employer paying your employees' children's school fees, you have certain tax, National Insurance and reporting obligations.


*[HMRC]:HM Revenue & Customs
table.title: Overview

table.body:
You don't have to report anything to HMRC or pay tax and National Insurance if all of the following apply:

- the contract is between you and the school
- you pay the fees directly
- your employee earns [at a rate](/employer-reporting-introduction-to-expenses-and-benefits/calculate-earnings-at-a-rate "at a rate") of less than £8,500 a year

*[HMRC]:HM Revenue & Customs
table.title: What's exempt

table.body:
If the school fees aren't [exempt](/expenses-and-benefits-school-fees-for-employees-child/whats-exempt "exemptions"), you may have to report the costs to HMRC, and you may have to deduct and pay tax and National Insurance. 

##If your employee pays and you reimburse the fees

This counts as earnings, so you'll need to:

* add the cost of the fees to the employee's other earnings
* deduct and pay Class 1 National Insurance and PAYE tax through payroll

##The contract is between your employee and the school, but you pay the fees directly

Who gets the benefit | What to do | What to deduct or pay 
- | - | -
Employees earning [at a rate](/employer-reporting-introduction-to-expenses-and-benefits/calculate-earnings-at-a-rate "at a rate") of less than £8,500 a year | Report on form P9D, section A(2) | Class 1 National Insurance on the cost of the fees through payroll 
Employees earning [at a rate](/employer-reporting-introduction-to-expenses-and-benefits/calculate-earnings-at-a-rate "at a rate") of £8,500 or more a year | Report on form P11D, section B | Class 1 National Insurance on the cost of the fees through payroll
Directors | Report on form P11D, section B | Class 1 National Insurance on the cost of the fees through payroll  

##The contract is between you and the school and you pay the fees directly

For employees earning [at a rate](/employer-reporting-introduction-to-expenses-and-benefits/calculate-earnings-at-a-rate "at a rate") of £8,500 a year, or directors:

* report on form P11D, section M
* pay Class 1A National Insurance on the cost of the fees


*[HMRC]:HM Revenue & Customs
*[PAYE]:Pay As You Earn
